meta.name: viewport
meta.title: Extended School Closure Messages from Dr. DeAngelis - Kennett Middle School

meta.content: Extended School Closure Messages from Dr. DeAngelis - Kennett Middle School

April 8, 2020 Greetings, KMS families! I hope you are all well and becoming more used to these unprecedented circumstances. My wife and I continue to discuss structures and schedules with our three children and it has been working for the most part! Not to say there isn’t an occasional meltdown from boredom and social...

meta.name: twitter:description
meta.content: April 8, 2020 Greetings, KMS families! I hope you are all well and becoming more used to these unprecedented circumstances. My wife and I continue to discuss structures and schedules with our three children and it has been working for the most part! Not to say there isn’t an occasional meltdown from boredom and social...

div.class: column sm-1-1 md-1-2 lg-1-2 content color-dark
div.p: The mission of the Kennett Consolidated School District is to provide a quality education that increases the achievement of every student in order for all to become successful and thoughtful contributors to society.

div.p: "Bancroft Elementary School is dedicated to creating a safe and rewarding educational experience for all children. Our goal is to focus on student success by fostering a positive, accepting and supportive learning environment where students are proud of the work that they do each day."

- Principal Leah McComsey,
Follow Me on Twitter @KCSDBancroft

- Principal Lorenzo DeAngelis
Follow Me On Twitter @KCSDKennettMS

p.span: Per Governor Wolf's April 9th announcement, all Pennsylvania schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. As a result, n
ew instruction for secondary students began Monday, March 30 and new instruction for elementary will begin on Tuesday, April 14.
Visit the Coronavirus page posted on the District website for additional information.

p.class: column sm-1-1 md-2-3 lg-3-5 hidden lg-show

span.span: Home » News » Extended School Closure Messages from Dr. DeAngelis

div.class: column sm-1-1 md-1-1 lg-2-5 sm-text-left md-text-left lg-text-right

section.class: posts-grid-wrapper sm-grid-1 md-grid-1 lg-grid-1 gap-30 rev15 post-archive grid equal-height

div.h1: Extended School Closure Messages from Dr. DeAngelis

div.p: Greetings, KMS families!

I hope you are all well and becoming more used to these unprecedented circumstances. My wife and I continue to discuss structures and schedules with our three children and it has been working for the most part! Not to say there isn’t an occasional meltdown from boredom and social distancing, but these are becoming less and less each day. We realize we are certainly becoming closer as a family and I think our boys are actually beginning to like each other :)

Making connections with the outside world through Facetime, Zoom, text messaging, and the old fashioned telephone call have been quite helpful in keeping us connected with family and friends. I hope you all are able to do the same to stay connected and to feel a bit of normalcy. Lastly, whatever you do, don’t try your jeans on! I am sure a lot of home cooking of delicious meals is occurring! Remember, long walks and bike rides are our friends.

With this letter, I am including a link to inform you of some new changes that we are putting into place since Governor Wolf’s announcement of schools being closed indefinitely. This link includes an in depth and comprehensive explanation of our KMS Continuity of Education Plan. Please take time to read this Continuity of Education Plan and understand that these decisions were made with a thoughtful and collaborative effort. During this effort, multiple scenarios were discussed and these decisions were fundamentally made with the philosophy of what is best for our students. Here are some highlights of our plan:

ul.li: Attendance – Beginning April 13, 2020, student attendance will be tracked based on work completion and if students are regularly communicating with teachers.

Grading – Final Grades will be calculated based on Marking Periods 1, 2, and 3 (33.3% each) and teachers can override the Final Grade based on the completion of work during Distance Learning Period (DLP) from April 13, 2020 until further notice. *Please note: This is intended to promote learning, motivate students, and help those who would like to increase their Final Grade in each class during this unprecedented time. No student’s Final Grade will decrease in the event of not completing assigned work during the DLP.

div.p: To view the detailed plan and suggested student schedule, please click here: KMS Continuity of Education Plan.
Lastly, I continue to hope and pray that you are all well. Through these times we will only become stronger as a community.
Sincerely with Kennett PRIDE,
Lorenzo G. DeAngelis Jr., Ed.D.

a.title:
Snow Make Up Days
Students will now have school on Monday, February 15 as a snow make up day for Monday, January 25.
Additionally, students will have school on Wednesday, June 15 as a snow make up day for Tuesday, January 26.
